gov.usgs.alarm

Class EventInputer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • gov.usgs.alarm.EventInputer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    UdpEventProcess

    public class EventInputer
extends java.lang.Thread
    This class is the super class to any inputer of events. Originally on the UDP based UDPEventProcess extended this class but others are expected. It uses the DBAccess to get information about known events. Through the findEvent() static function it gives access to all of the events. Via handleEvent() it gives a method to build and event and track it.

    • Method Detail

      • deq

        public static java.lang.String deq(java.lang.String s)

      • handleEvent

        public Event handleEvent(java.lang.String source,
                         java.lang.String code,
                         java.lang.String phrase,
                         java.lang.String process,
                         java.lang.String node)
        given the raw strings that make up an event, handle its input to alarm. This involves insuring the event is in the database, creating it if necessary, and creating a clone of the generally event and updating same with this particular instance data. The data are damped and events acted upon via EventHandler.declareEvent()
        Parameters:
        source - The source string
        code - the code within the source that makes this event unique
        phrase - General text issued by the event
        process - The process associated with this instance of the event
        node - The computer node or other grouping (Line SNWGroup) associated with this instance of the event
        Returns:
        a clone of a general event record with the instance data set (node, process and phrase, event time).

      • findEvent

        public static Event findEvent(java.lang.String src,
                              java.lang.String cd,
                              java.lang.String payload)
        Find an event given the source, code, and payload
        1) If source and code are set, use them to look up the event
        2) If source or code are blank, use regular expression
        Parameters:
        src - The source code to match
        cd - The code to match
        payload - The payload of the message
        Returns:
        null if no match is found, else a Event object matching these parameters.
